#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Enjoy a Book
#Text=Do you want to become an avid reader but do n't know how to enjoy a book ?
#Text=Do you find reading tedious ?
#Text=Do all the words make your head hurt ?
#Text=It 's time for you to start reading and enjoying it .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Pick out a good book that you are interested in reading .
#Text=If you like mystery , head over to the mystery section .
#Text=If you like fantasy , go to the fantasy section , etc.
#Text=Remember to read the back of the book to see if the plot looks interesting , and most importantly , do n't judge a book by it 's cover .
#Text=Find a quiet or calming place .
#Text=This will help you become the character and focus more on the book .
#Text=When you find the calm place , make sure you have a comfortable spot , for this will help you relax .
#Text=Put yourself in the character 's shoes .
#Text=Focus on what they say .
#Text=What they hear , smell , see , feel , taste .
#Text=Once you put yourself where the character is , you will feel as if you are really there .
#Text=Understand .
#Text=Look up the meaning of all the words you do n't understand or have n't heard .
#Text=In case of classic literature , you could also look up some background for the story to put it into historical context .
#Text=This will allow you to see the book from the authors view and understand why they wrote that or why the story progressed the way it did .
#Text=Go deeper .
#Text=Think outside the box .
#Text=Maybe instead of what did happen , think about what would happen if the character did something different .
#Text=Allow yourself to enter your book and stretch all the possibilities and limits the author has set before you and make up your own events .
#Text=Take notes as you read .
#Text=This would allow you to think about what your read .
#Text=Take breaks from the book to help you picture things better .
#Text=When you take these breaks that they really help you see the book more clearly .
#Text=Enjoy the book .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Do n't skim .
#Text=Read the book slowly and calmly picking up as much information as you can in order to understand the book more .
#Text=Remember , reading is for enjoyment .
#Text=It 's not a race so take your time .
#Text=Go to your local library or book store for books .
#Text=Ask for help if you do n't know what to get ; the people who work there will have great recommendations .
#Text=If you are n't a serious reader , I would suggest starting out at the library so you can return the book if you do n't like it .
#Text=It always helps to read books before you go to bed because it gives you something pleasant to dream about .
#Text=While you are reading your book , just find out the conclusion of that particular topic .
#Text=You do n't need to remember all the story .
#Text=Just find the conclusion by yourself and write down .
#Text=Do not over-read .
#Text=This could cause headaches and you would miss the thrill of guessing what 's next in the book .
#Text=Things You 'll Need
#Text=Books
#Text=Notebook
#Text=Pen
